data.text: @rquiroga777 @TracyBethHoeg You are right. We have seen far fewer numbers in our adult hospital of all the previously typical viruses (flu, RSV, etc) with measures to control covid
@GYamey @TracyBethHoeg It's not very helpful. It's INCREDIBLY helpful!

@KIDSFIR91979351 @PEHJackson @KelleyKga @TracyBethHoeg @ajlamesa @HelenBranswell My hypotheses are either we got lucky with a particularly low transmissibility in current strains, or maybe more likely lack of international travel prevented introductions.  Or both.

@NilsHeadley @Bigsmiffy438 @DL_138 @TracyBethHoeg I question that table. Someone born in w010 has a life expectancy almost 9 years less than someone born in 2019. These figures for life expectancy are lower than they were when I was born.

@SabiVM @TracyBethHoeg CDC flu deaths ages 0-17:

2017/18 flu season:  526 (admitted low estimate by CDC)
2018/2019: 372 (admitted low estimate by CDC)
2020-2022 (22 months) on your chart: 1150...or 627 per year.  

That's what you're scaring the shit out of people for?
@joe_spreitzer @TracyBethHoeg So? How does that change the number of kids who have died from Covid? Also, in case you missed it, this graph doesnâ€™t compare mortality *rates*.

@zoonotic1 @DeNovo_Fatima @dfreedman7 @KStateTurk @GYamey @TracyBethHoeg It's just so dimwitted to say, "Covid deaths are roughly equal to flu" so let's care about neither. Caring about neither, at the very least, is a doubling of deaths. To my mind, that's a good reason to care about both.
But maybe you are right; there must be a secret contest. :)

@TracyBethHoeg @DL_138 It's marshaling out of context statistics in favor of a stupid argument that undermines public health. You're disgusting. 1000+ dead kids who could have lived if we'd just been not stupid? Fuck off.
